Description: Bronze axe-head: with two long, thick lugs, concave sides and almost straight cutting edge. The narrowest point of the blade is somewhat nearer the butt than the cutting edge. The corners of the cutting edge are rounded. The blade is pitted all over and the cutting edge is damaged.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (127)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
